availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Alzada Nichols. Father of William Nichols, John Nichols, L. A. Nichols, and B. A. Nichols. Farmer in Princeton, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Wright Irvin as a farmhand in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 77.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Bucksnort, p. 410A.
"Levin Nichols (1834-1902)," Find A Grave, Memorial #89687442, accessed July 8, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89687442.
